Outside the Ark:

Uproar paces back and forth, as part of his own thinking =
process.  He tended to do that when he was in deep thought, which wasn't to=
o often for him.  Quickstride watches.  

It was almost as if the curious c=
at was trying to bring out his resourceful side, which to him was a bit dif=
ficult.  He then looks to fallen rocks on the ground, of different sizes.  =
Quickstride gives him and Rodimus and the others a perplexed look.

" Well,=
 that's really nice of you guys to be concerned..  Hmm, umm, I dunno what U=
proar's up to.  Not like him ta be fixated on tiny objects like that..."

U=
proar looks up to everyone.

"Oh, sorry, I didn't mean to go into wierd mod=
e.  I'm lookn' at these rocks because, some of these may be comrpised of di=
fferent minerals and alloys.  Maybe one of them has an alloy that's resista=
nt to the force shield.. And what if one of these was batted into the field=
...  And maybe, if there is an outside pannel that controls it, could that =
rock be swatted at the controls, and disable the field long enough ta get u=
s all through without a hitch?"

Quickstride looks to Leo#2, and the others=
.

" Heeey, guys, he's onta something.  Rodimus, do you know if the Ark's g=
ot an external control pannel for the force shield?  If so, we might just h=
ave this problem solved."

Uproar demonstrates his knack for swatting at ro=
cks, as he swatts one in an opposite direction a good distance away from th=
e group.

"See?  What'dya think?"

Inside the Black Fortress, Rat Trap heav=
es a temporarry sigh of relief, knowing that it's clear sailing for Windlor=
d and himself.

"Whew, we're off the hook for now, but we'd be better off i=
f we could get a little further away from here. I can't wait ta get home, w=
here it's safe, and we don't have ta worry about gettn' our tails toasted."=


Outside the Ark, Night Shift didn't care how long it would take the Furzo=
rs to help Tucson, he was just very happy to get the assistance.  He looks =
to Torca with a smile of appreciation.

"Heey, whatever you can do for us, =
works, speed or no speed.  Okay Kup, that's it, but don't strain your engin=
e, okay?  Time for me ta start pulln' my own weight too."

He gets into his=
 vehicle mode, and zooms up to Kup as he works beside him. 

"Don't worry T=
ucson, we got you."

Tucson clings to consciousness as best he can.  

"Tha=
nk you.  I appreciate everyone's help.  But - please, do - not strain your =
systems on my - account."

Sensing Talon inside, Tucson tries to regulate t=
he climate inside his cab, to help make her feel more comfortable.  Even th=
at was quite a chore, as he tries to deliver a good amount of Air filtratio=
n and conditioning to cool the atmosphere, yet deliver enough oxygen to cle=
an it as well.

" Talon, are - you all right?"

=
> OUTSIDE THE ARK
> 
> Rodimus and Leo II sat there listening as Uproar and=
 Quickstride relate their idea about attempting to disrupt the forcefield w=
ith their bodies while the rest of the group got through. 
> 
> Leo II, jus=
t shook his head as a small smile sketched itself on his, "No lads." He sai=
d, his voice serious, despite the smile, "There is no reason for you to sac=
rifice yourselves like that."
> 
> Wing Caliber, one of the Maximal tactica=
l specialists, nodded, "Besides, if it were that easy to get in, don't you =
think Megatron would have sacrificed a few of his troops to get through yea=
rs ago before this Hydras showed up?"
> 
> Rodimus smiled at Leo II and Win=
g Caliber thankful for their input, "They are right. No we need you two her=
e with us."
> 
> Rodimus paused as he got a call . . . 
> 
> > Perceptor op=
ened his comlink to Rodimus and said "Less than 2 mins... 
> > Nightlight i=
s free; we will sedate her, I have an idea to see if 
> > reprogramation ac=
tually worked, but i need you here"
> 
> "I read you." He said as he looked=
 back at the others, holding up his hand, it would soon be time. Rodimus gl=
anced at the Ark, "Just a little bit more." He said as he held out his sign=
ature scrambling device, ready to use it. 
> 
> Leo II, Wing Caliber and Ra=
mulus tensed up, ready to dash when Rodimus gave the signal. 
> 
> 
> INSID=
E THE ARK
> 
> As Perceptor communicated with Rodimus on the outside, Legac=
y, Bump and Santon continued to oversee the reboot of Nightlight, Bump and =
Santon giving a visible sight of relief as her systems were beginning to co=
me up.
> 
> Legacy carefully positioned a device over Nightlight's chest an=
d delivered a sedative, one that would keep her systems stable but would al=
so keep her unconscious. 
> 
> Santon glanced over at Perceptor and then ba=
ck at Nightlight, shaking his head, obviously uncomfortable about the whole=
 thing, saving Nightlight by working with the very being who had subjected =
her to this in the first place. However for the moment he was content to le=
t things lie.  
> 
> Meanwhile, elsewhere in the Ark, 
> 
> "Elita! Elita!"=
 Lord Elder's voice could be heard near by. Even though he was whispering a=
s loud as he could, his voice sounded weak as the sounds of a shuffled move=
ment could be heard in the darkness of Elita's room. 
> 
> "Elita . . . " E=
lder's voice sounded as if it were getting further away. 
> 
> OUTSIDE THE =
TOWER
> 
> > Hydras started to move away, trying reach a safe distance; whi=
le he was 
> > doing that he open com link with all Predacons and said "TO =
ALL
> > PREDACONS LEAVE THE BLACKFORTRESS and sorrounding area,
> > NOW... =
FOLLOW MY SIGNAL!!!!!"
> 
> As Hydras gives the order the other Predacons t=
ransform into to Beast Mode to make their get away, the vast majority of th=
em taking to the air! The large door on the black Tower opens as Scourge an=
d Cyclonus fly out, both of them already in their aerial modes, boosters fl=
aring as they hit the skies!
> 
> However as they fly they can almost immed=
iately make out the form of Windlord as he carried Rat Trap in his claws, t=
he duo began to change their vector of flight, angling towards them. 
> 
> =
"Sir." Cyclonus transmited over his radio to Hydras, "The Maximals that att=
empted to break into the Fortress are trying to make their get away as well=
. Shall we terminate them?"
> 
> They began to fly after Windlord, their su=
perior speed in the air making it easy for them to begin to close the dista=
nce between them, rocket and missile launchers beginning to glow as they ta=
rgeted the flying Maximals. 
> 
> Meanwhile on the ground, 
> 
> Torca nodd=
ed as Hydras and the other Predacons began to back off. "We Fuzors don't ha=
ve wheels and drive." He said to Nightshift as looked around and then glanc=
ed back at Tuscon in vehicular mode. "But let's see what we can do."
> 
> "=
BANTOR!" Torca called out, "Beast Mode!" 
> 
> The Maximal in question quic=
kly transformed into the somewhat bizzar alternate mode, becoming a cross b=
etween a baboon and a Tiger; looking strong and powerful, even if unconvent=
ional.
> 
> With that Torca transformed into his beastmode as well, that of=
 an elephant and a Killer whale. He along with Bantor positioned themselves=
 to the front of Tuscon. "We won't be the fastest things, but we can get yo=
u home." Torca said as he waited to pull. 
> 
> Above their heads Noctorro,=
 Air Hammer and Silverbolt take to the skies, becoming an aerial escort to =
the injured Maximals and Autobots!
